svcproc.title: EOP Switch (Engine Oil Pressure)
svcproc.para: A ceramic diaphragm switch located in the oil filter base assembly. The ECM monitors the EOP signal for reference only. The ECM uses the EOP signal to control the instrument panel oil pressure gauge and for EWPS warning, lights the engine warning lamp for low oil pressure. The EOP switch closes a circuit to ground after the engine oil pressure reaches 34 kPa to 48 kPa (5 psi to 7 psi). When the pressure is above 48 kPa (7 psi) the gauge reads normal. If the oil pressure drops below 41 kPa (6 psi) the gauge reads 0 kPa (0 psi).
